modName: Decreasing Enchanted Item Prices Bug Fix - DELETED
summary: This mod fixes the bug that enchanted items have lower prices as your skill increases.
descriptionHtml:
[b][size=5]What it does...[/size][/b]
This mod fixes the bug that enchanted items have lower prices as your skill increases.
For example, enchanting an iron dagger with turn undead using petty gem at enchanting level 15 yields base value of 760 septims. At enchanting level 100, it's somehow reduced to 328 septims.
With this mod, the price at level 100 is adjusted to 816 septims.

[b][size=5]How it does...[/size][/b]
Normally, you cannot adjust the price/skill relation because it is hard-coded. That's why there is no mod fixing this issue yet, or at least I haven't seen one. Shout out to [url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/2266759-enchanted-items-value-workaroundfix/]RR88 from this thread[/url]﻿ for suggesting a work around of this. If you change the setting [b]fEnchantingSkillCostScale [/b]dynamically with your skill level, the price can be made almost balanced. The value[color=#00ffff][code] fEnchantingSkillCostScale = 0.50+0.02*(EnchLvl - 15) [/code][/color]seem to be the best value you can get. The script that update this value is attached to the "SkillIncrease" event which triggers every time player increases any skill level. [b]Edit: I also trigger the script every time you use the enchanter table (both variant) because the gamesetting always reset every time you load the save.[/b]

Be reminded: this mod only works as intended up to level 100. Beyond that, the value might decrease again due to the internal formula.

Because I've never seen this kind of mod, so I don't know if it has unwanted effects or not. Use at your own risk.
